content:
• Tuesday, February 7, 2012
  • TNK

    Teekay Tankers (NYSE:TNK) trades down in the post session after announcing a 15M share secondary...

    Teekay Tankers (NYSE:TNK) trades down in the post session after announcing a 15M share secondary offering. Proceeds are expected to go to repay a portion of its outstanding debt under its revolving credit facility. Shares -9.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:04 PM | 5 Comments
  • CERN

    More on Cerner (NASDAQ:CERN): Q4 beats across the board as the company posted solid sales...

    More on Cerner (NASDAQ:CERN): Q4 beats across the board as the company posted solid sales growth. Revenue rose by 23% Y/Y, with a 44% jump in bookings and a 24% increase in its revenue backlog. The company also made positive comments on its FY12 guidance, saying it expects the market for health-care information technology to remain strong as health professionals and hospitals convert to electronic records. Shares +6.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:44 PM
  • SNCR

    Synchronoss Technologies (NASDAQ:SNCR): Q4 EPS of $0.34 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $62.3M...

    Synchronoss Technologies (NASDAQ:SNCR): Q4 EPS of $0.34 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $62.3M (+21.7% Y/Y) beats by $0.8M. Shares +9.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:38 PM
  • RICK

    Rick's Cabaret International (NASDAQ:RICK): FQ1 EPS of $0.23 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $22M...

    Rick's Cabaret International (NASDAQ:RICK): FQ1 EPS of $0.23 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $22M (+11.8% Y/Y) beats by $0.2M. Shares -6.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:32 PM
  • OPNT-OLD

    More on Opnet's FQ3: No explanation is provided for light revenue and EPS figures. However, it's...

    More on Opnet's FQ3: No explanation is provided for light revenue and EPS figures. However, it's noted Opnet's gross margin fell 150 bps Y/Y to 77.3%. Deferred revenue rose 13% Q/Q and 16% Y/Y to $49.8M. Opnet expects FQ4 revenue of $45M-$49M and EPS of $0.20-$0.32, compared with Street estimates of $48.1M and $0.30. OPNT-OLD -9.2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:22 PM
  • PNRA

    Panera Bread (NASDAQ:PNRA): Q4 EPS of $1.42 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $495.7M (+15.8% Y/Y)...

    Panera Bread (NASDAQ:PNRA): Q4 EPS of $1.42 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $495.7M (+15.8% Y/Y) beats by $3.3M. Shares -2.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:13 PM
  • OPNT-OLD

    OPNET Technologies (NASDAQ:OPNT-OLD): FQ3 EPS of $0.26 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $46M (+15.9%...

    OPNET Technologies (NASDAQ:OPNT-OLD): FQ3 EPS of $0.26 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $46M (+15.9% Y/Y) misses by $0.4M. Shares -9.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:02 PM
  • NTGR

    Netgear (NASDAQ:NTGR): Q4 EPS of $0.69 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $309.2M (+19.6% Y/Y) beats by...

    Netgear (NASDAQ:NTGR): Q4 EPS of $0.69 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $309.2M (+19.6% Y/Y) beats by $2M. Shares -1.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:59 PM
  • GUID

    More on Guidance Software's Q4: Guidance expects 2012 revenue of $126M-$131M and EPS of...

    More on Guidance Software's Q4: Guidance expects 2012 revenue of $126M-$131M and EPS of $0.35-$0.42, above a consensus of $113.3M and $0.29. Along with the Q4 report, Guidance announces it's acquiring Case Central, a provider of cloud-based e-discovery software. Case Central is expected to boost 2012 sales by $10M, but is seen as having a negligible impact on earnings until 2013.  GUID +13.6% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:55 PM
  • GLUU

    Glu Mobile (NASDAQ:GLUU): Q4 EPS of -$0.02 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $15.2M (+29.7% Y/Y) misses...

    Glu Mobile (NASDAQ:GLUU): Q4 EPS of -$0.02 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $15.2M (+29.7% Y/Y) misses by $1.7M. Shares +2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:27 PM
  • SGI

    Silicon Graphics (NASDAQ:SGI): FQ2 EPS of $0.04 misses by $0.21. Revenue of $195.2M (+10% Y/Y)...

    Silicon Graphics (NASDAQ:SGI): FQ2 EPS of $0.04 misses by $0.21. Revenue of $195.2M (+10% Y/Y) misses by $1.8M. Expects FY12 revenue of $770M-$800M, above $756.3M consensus. Expects FY12 EPS of $0.15-$0.30, well below $0.67 consensus. Company says gross margin hit by "challenging economic conditions in Europe and the high cost of doing business there." Shares -24.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:15 PM
  • CALX

    Calix (NYSE:CALX): Q4 EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $91.6M (flat Y/Y) beats by $2M....

    Calix (NYSE:CALX): Q4 EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $91.6M (flat Y/Y) beats by $2M. Shares +8.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM
  • AVID

    More on Avid Technology (NASDAQ:AVID): FQ1 easily beats EPS estimates despite a 5.1% overall dip...

    More on Avid Technology (NASDAQ:AVID): FQ1 easily beats EPS estimates despite a 5.1% overall dip in Y/Y revenue. Margins were the highest they've been since 2005, as the company streamlined operations and improved execution across virtually all business lines. Shares +13.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • OPEN

    OpenTable (NASDAQ:OPEN): Q4 EPS of $0.37 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $37.2M (+21% Y/Y) beats by...

    OpenTable (NASDAQ:OPEN): Q4 EPS of $0.37 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $37.2M (+21% Y/Y) beats by $0.4M. North American revenue +22% Y/Y, international revenue +15%. Shares +6.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • DIS

    More on Disney's FQ1: Growth was fueled a 10% Y/Y revenue increase for the Parks & Resorts...

    More on Disney's FQ1: Growth was fueled a 10% Y/Y revenue increase for the Parks & Resorts division, and hurt by declines of 16% and 10%, respectively, for the Studio Entertainment and Interactive Media (gaming) divisions. After respectively growing 9% and 14% in FQ4, the Media Networks and Consumer Products divisions only grew 3% each. A 7% drop in broadcasting revenue (ABC) hurt Media Networks. DIS -2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 2 Comments
  • ORN

    Orion Marine Group (ORN +1.9%) finishes higher today after winning a $32M contract award for the...

    Orion Marine Group (ORN +1.9%) finishes higher today after winning a $32M contract award for the construction of two new ship docks and three barge docks for a private customer in the Gulf Coast region. The Company will also perform dredging to deepen the existing channel to accommodate larger vessels.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • TCAP-OLD

    Triangle Capital (NYSE:TCAP-OLD) falls 2.6% AH after filing for a 3.7M stock offering, good for...

    Triangle Capital (NYSE:TCAP-OLD) falls 2.6% AH after filing for a 3.7M stock offering, good for proceeds of $50.3M based on today's close. The company plans to partly use the proceeds to invest in "lower middle market companies."

     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • DIS

    Disney (NYSE:DIS): FQ1 EPS of $0.80 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $10.78B (+1% Y/Y) misses by...

    Disney (NYSE:DIS): FQ1 EPS of $0.80 beats by $0.09. Revenue of $10.78B (+1% Y/Y) misses by $400M. Shares -2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 1 Comment
  • BWLD

    More on Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD): Q4 blows out across the board on nearly a 34% jump in Y/Y...

    More on Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD): Q4 blows out across the board on nearly a 34% jump in Y/Y revenue, with strong sales coming from both new and existing franchises. Same-store sales grew by 8.9% at company-owned and 5.9% at franchised locations, surpassing $2B in total FY11 system-wide sales. Shares +13.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • AVID

    Avid Technology (NASDAQ:AVID): Q4 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.23. Revenue of $185.3M (-5.1% Y/Y)...

    Avid Technology (NASDAQ:AVID): Q4 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.23. Revenue of $185.3M (-5.1% Y/Y) beats by $9M. Shares +10.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • BWLD

    Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD): Q4 EPS of $0.73 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $220M (+34% Y/Y) beats by...

    Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD): Q4 EPS of $0.73 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $220M (+34% Y/Y) beats by $10M. Shares +12.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • CNVR

    ValueClick (VCLK): Q4 EPS of $0.47 beats by $0.17. Revenue of $182.6M (+42% Y/Y) beats by $7M....

    ValueClick (VCLK): Q4 EPS of $0.47 beats by $0.17. Revenue of $182.6M (+42% Y/Y) beats by $7M. Shares -1.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • CERN

    Cerner (NASDAQ:CERN): Q4 EPS of $0.55 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $615.6M (+23% Y/Y) beats by...

    Cerner (NASDAQ:CERN): Q4 EPS of $0.55 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $615.6M (+23% Y/Y) beats by $30M. Shares +2.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • AMRS

    Amyris (AMRS -8%) get hit by a downgrade to Outperform at Raymond James, saying the company's...

    Amyris (AMRS -8%) get hit by a downgrade to Outperform at Raymond James, saying the company's announcement of a special analyst call on February 9 is unusual given the Q4 call is on February 27. The firm advises caution going into it.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • GSM

    Globe Specialty Metals (GSM -2.6%) loses ground after being downgraded to Neutral at JP Morgan...

    Globe Specialty Metals (GSM -2.6%) loses ground after being downgraded to Neutral at JP Morgan earlier today, citing a lower silicon metal/alloy price forecast.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • LPX

    Louisiana-Pacific (LPX -6.6%) dips after missing its Q4 estimates on all fronts. Losses widened...

    Louisiana-Pacific (LPX -6.6%) dips after missing its Q4 estimates on all fronts. Losses widened slightly Y/Y, despite posting gains on a large asset-sale, as the construction-materials company's overall sales for the quarter grew slower than expected.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM
  • RTI

    RTI International Metal (RTI -11.1%) gets hammered after its Q4 results missed EPS estimates...

    RTI International Metal (RTI -11.1%) gets hammered after its Q4 results missed EPS estimates despite a 23% jump in Y/Y profit. Restructuring costs contributed to the shortfall as the company transitions to a fully-integrated end-to-end supplier of advanced titanium components, plus weakness in its fabrication unit due to third party material delivery delays which resulted in lower operating income.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • HBI

    Hanesbrands (HBI +4.6%) moves higher on an upgrade to Buy from BB&T, citing the company's...

    Hanesbrands (HBI +4.6%) moves higher on an upgrade to Buy from BB&T, citing the company's improving risk/reward profile.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • BMTI

    BioMimetic Therapeutics (BMTI +12.2%) soars a day after reporting positive data from a small...

    BioMimetic Therapeutics (BMTI +12.2%) soars a day after reporting positive data from a small trial testing its augment bone graft device in patients undergoing surgery for rotator cuff injuries. The FDA last month declined to approve the graft and sought more data, but the new information boosts hopes of attracting interest from potential partners.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • NFX

    Newfield Exploration (NFX -1.5%) trades down after being cut to Neutral at UBS, saying the...

    Newfield Exploration (NFX -1.5%) trades down after being cut to Neutral at UBS, saying the company's liquids production growth came in lower than expectations in 2011 and guidance for FY12 also looks disappointing.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM

  • Lufkin Industries (LUFK, +3.7%) gets a lift after Suntrust Robinson Humphrey upped the shares to...

    Lufkin Industries (LUFK, +3.7%) gets a lift after Suntrust Robinson Humphrey upped the shares to Buy earlier today. Suntrust says the company is poised to gain from material internal and external earnings growth, and the benefits yet to be realized from its acquisition last year of Quinn's Oilfield Supply.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • DBD

    Diebold (DBD +4.4%) is raised to Neutral from Underweight with a new $34.50 price target from...

    Diebold (DBD +4.4%) is raised to Neutral from Underweight with a new $34.50 price target from $29 at J.P. Morgan following strong Q4 results and 2012 guidance from rival ATM-maker NCR (NCR +10.5%). The firm admits it underestimated demand in the financial services sector, "and we are reintroducing growth into segment revenue in mid-2012."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • WDC

    SanDisk (SNDK -3.3%) trades lower, perhaps due to a Digitimes report claiming the company has...

    SanDisk (SNDK -3.3%) trades lower, perhaps due to a Digitimes report claiming the company has slashed prices for its memory cards and flash drives. The move is said to be in response to across-the-board cuts from rival Kingston Technology. SanDisk sold off last month following its Q4 report, after the company's tepid 2012 guidance raised fears of soft customer demand and emerging price pressure.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • DNB

    Dun & Bradstreet's (DNB -5.1%) Q4 earnings rose 1% on a double-digit percentage revenue...

    Dun & Bradstreet's (DNB -5.1%) Q4 earnings rose 1% on a double-digit percentage revenue growth in its Asia Pacific operations and improvement in its North American business. But the business information provider forecast adjusted earnings growth of 8%-11% for the current year, below consensus 12%, sending shares sliding.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • SOHU

    Sohu.com (SOHU -2.8%) adds to yesterday's losses after being downgraded to Neutral on valuation...

    Sohu.com (SOHU -2.8%) adds to yesterday's losses after being downgraded to Neutral on valuation at Susquehanna earlier, citing its disappointing guidance yesterday. RBS also cut the shares to Hold due to a decline in its ad earnings.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • SINA

    Sina (SINA -6.7%) sells off after DigiCha reports all users of Sina's wildly popular Weibo...

    Sina (SINA -6.7%) sells off after DigiCha reports all users of Sina's wildly popular Weibo microblogging platform will be required to register with their real names as of March 16. It's added that since new users have been required to provide their real names, Weibo's registration rate has fallen to 2.5M/month. It's speculated some of this decline may be due to a lack of "zombie/spam accounts" being registered.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • SHPG

    The FDA approves Shire's (SHPGY +3.6%) prescription medication Vyvanse, the first...

    The FDA approves Shire's (SHPGY +3.6%) prescription medication Vyvanse, the first medication proven to work and approved for maintenance treatment for adults with ADHD.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • SHLDQ

    The "classic short squeeze" must not have run its course, as Sears (SHLD +7%) shares again spike...

    The "classic short squeeze" must not have run its course, as Sears (SHLD +7%) shares again spike higher on no real news. No stock is more subject to rumor mongering and takeover talk than Sears; today, speculation has the retailer working with Goldman Sachs (NYSE:GS) to find a buyer.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • PXP

    Plains Exploration & Production (PXP +4.1%) gains after releasing its preliminary FY11...

    Plains Exploration & Production (PXP +4.1%) gains after releasing its preliminary FY11 results earlier today, saying daily sales volume climbed 13% in Q4, including 12% growth in oil and liquids volume, driven by solid production from its Eagle Ford and Haynesville shale stakes.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • GTIV

    Gentiva Health Services (GTIV -5.8%) takes a hit despite beating Q4 estimates. Net profit...

    Gentiva Health Services (GTIV -5.8%) takes a hit despite beating Q4 estimates. Net profit slumped 71% Y/Y, and it now expects the impact of Medicare slashing reibursment rates and lowering leverage ratios to push it out of compliance with its financial covenant ratios this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • FN

    Contract manufacturer Fabrinet (FN +10.1%) jumps after its FQ2 report suggests it's recovering...

    Contract manufacturer Fabrinet (FN +10.1%) jumps after its FQ2 report suggests it's recovering faster than expected from the damage inflicted by Thai flooding. The company's FQ3 revenue guidance of $131M-$136M is slightly below a $137M consensus, but its EPS guidance of $0.22-$0.24 handily beats a Street forecast of $0.07. A couple of customers are rising in sympathy: JDSU +3.8%. OCLR +1.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM
  • CNQ

    Canadian Natural Resources (CNQ -4.9%) will shut down its oil sands plant in northern Alberta...

    Canadian Natural Resources (CNQ -4.9%) will shut down its oil sands plant in northern Alberta for two to three weeks, according to a source. The shutdown follows a maintenance check on the company's plant - the 4th largest tar sands mining and crude processing facility in Canada.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM | 1 Comment
  • ZAGG

    Zagg (ZAGG +2.2%) trades higher after announcing that it retained a search firm to help it...

    Zagg (ZAGG +2.2%) trades higher after announcing that it retained a search firm to help it conduct a search for new board members.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM
  • TDG

    TransDigm Group (TDG +4.8%) trades up after its FQ1 beat estimates earlier today. Profits soared...

    TransDigm Group (TDG +4.8%) trades up after its FQ1 beat estimates earlier today. Profits soared 50% Y/Y due to prior-year refinancing costs and a big boost from acquisitions. The company also raises its FY12 forecast, now expecting an EPS between $5.66 - $6 on revenue of $1.47B - $1.51B, above the Street EPS view of $5.58 on $1.47B in revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM

  • CDC Corp. (CDCAQ.PK +76.7%) and scandal-ridden subsidiary CDC Software (CDCSY.PK +73.5%) soar...

    CDC Corp. (CDCAQ.PK +76.7%) and scandal-ridden subsidiary CDC Software (CDCSY.PK +73.5%) soar after the former agrees to sell its 87% stake in the latter to Archipelago Holdings for $249.8M in cash. CDC Corp. filed for Chapter 11 in October.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM | 1 Comment
  • SMG

    Scotts Miracle-Gro (SMG +8.8%) pops after its FQ1 beats previously reduced estimates despite...

    Scotts Miracle-Gro (SMG +8.8%) pops after its FQ1 beats previously reduced estimates despite widening losses, as the lawn-and-garden products company was hit by a decline in sales volume and higher material costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM
  • RBC

    Regal Beloit (RBC +7.8%) jumps after reporting Q4 revenue of $727M (+31% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.93,...

    Regal Beloit (RBC +7.8%) jumps after reporting Q4 revenue of $727M (+31% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.93, beating Street estimates by $5.4M and $0.23. Results were boosted by acquisitions, but also got a lift from growing sales to North American commercial and industrial customers, which helped offset a drop in residential HVAC sales. Regal recently acquired Milwaukee Gear Company for $80M.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM
  • OFIX

    Orthofix (OFIX, +3.6%) says it's reached a series of agreements to resolve federal...

    Orthofix (OFIX, +3.6%) says it's reached a series of agreements to resolve federal investigations into various criminal matters in three of its businesses. The company had been facing a number of charges, including allegations of bribery, as U.S. authorities step up enforcement of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • LNCR

    Lincare Holdings (LNCR -5.5%) trades lower after posting a tepid in-line Q4. Net profits fell...

    Lincare Holdings (LNCR -5.5%) trades lower after posting a tepid in-line Q4. Net profits fell 3.3% Y/Y as the oxygen-equipment provider was hurt by higher product and services costs, as well as rising overhead and bad-debt expenses.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • OUTR

    Coinstar (CSTR +18.3%) makes new 52-week highs after delivering strong earnings and guidance (I,...

    Coinstar (CSTR +18.3%) makes new 52-week highs after delivering strong earnings and guidance (I, II), and acquiring NCR's DVD kiosk business. Bill Wolf believes Coinstar can earn $5/share in 2012, well above its $3.80-$4.30 guidance range, thanks to surging per-kiosk sales and steady per-kiosk expenses. But Needham is concerned about the end of Redbox's wholesale deal with Time Warner, and the pending renewal of a similar deal with Universal.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • GCI

    Lazard lowers its stock rating on Gannett (GCI -2.2%) to Neutral from Buy, noting that the stock...

    Lazard lowers its stock rating on Gannett (GCI -2.2%) to Neutral from Buy, noting that the stock is "secularly challenged" following an "extraordinary two-month performance." The media company recently reported softening ad spending even as Q4 earnings came in above expectations.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • CFX

    Colfax Corp. (CFX -2%) dips after its Q4 misses expectations on both EPS and revenue on...

    Colfax Corp. (CFX -2%) dips after its Q4 misses expectations on both EPS and revenue on greater-than-anticipated acquisition charges and a slowdown in earnings growth. The company has been on a buying binge recently, purchasing the welding-equipment maker Charter International PLC for $2.4B last month, and privately held Cot-Puritech for $34M in December.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • URBN

    Street expectations are too high for Urban Outfitters (URBN -1%), Fossil (FOSL -0.1%) and...

    Street expectations are too high for Urban Outfitters (URBN -1%), Fossil (FOSL -0.1%) and Warnaco (WRC -1.1%), Brean Murray says in cutting its outlook on the three retailers. At URBN, the departure of CEO Glen Senk "almost ordain(s) that there will be no material turn until Holiday 2012, at the latest," while FOSL and WRC have overheated expectations despite strong market positions.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • BVSN

    BroadVision (BVSN -10.4%) has yet another volatile day featuring no news of importance. To...

    BroadVision (BVSN -10.4%) has yet another volatile day featuring no news of importance. To recap, the e-commerce software firm: a) rose 309% from the end of 2011 to its Jan. 24 high, b) fell 55% over the next 4 trading days, partly thanks to a poor Q4 report, c) subsequently rallied 99% over the next 6 trading days, before selling off today.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 1 Comment
  • VZ

    Verizon (VZ -0.7%) files a shelf registration statement with the SEC disclosing its intent to...

    Verizon (VZ -0.7%) files a shelf registration statement with the SEC disclosing its intent to sell a mix of securities worth up to $10B.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • BMY

    Better-than-expected quarterly results from Amylin Pharmaceuticals (AMLN +4.6%) grabs the...

    Better-than-expected quarterly results from Amylin Pharmaceuticals (AMLN +4.6%) grabs the attention of several brokerages: Citigroup raises its target price to $18 from $12, Baird lifts its target to $19 from $17, Jefferies hikes its target to $30 from $25, and BMO boosts its target to $26 from $17. Today's price surge amplifies AMLN's impressive 52% YTD climb.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • AMD

    AMD gains 2.8% following an upgrade to Buy from Longbow's Joanne Feeney. Feeney, who has...

    AMD gains 2.8% following an upgrade to Buy from Longbow's Joanne Feeney. Feeney, who has defended AMD in the past, says checks indicate manufacturing yields for the company's Llano and Trinity CPUs have improved, and have thus eliminated the supply constraints AMD faced last year. She's also positive on the impact of Rory Read's appointment as CEO.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • CHD

    Church & Dwight (CHD +4.6%) hits a new 52-week high after reporting Q4 earnings that beat...

    Church & Dwight (CHD +4.6%) hits a new 52-week high after reporting Q4 earnings that beat estimates this morning. Profit rose 36% Y/Y on better-than-expected sales growth despite intense price competition. The company also guides FY12 EPS to the high end of the range, now expecting to earn between $2.41 - 2.43 versus Street expectations of $2.41.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • SWI

    Systems management software firm SolarWinds (SWI +10.6%) makes new highs following its Q4 beat....

    Systems management software firm SolarWinds (SWI +10.6%) makes new highs following its Q4 beat. Surging deferred revenue resulted in a 28% Y/Y increase in free cash flow to $36.6M, a level well above net income of $16.3M. SolarWinds is guiding for Q1 revenue of $55.5M-$56.7M and EPS of $0.24-$0.25 (consensus of $54.4M and $0.25), and 2012 revenue of $245M-$255M and EPS of $1.10-$1.15 (consensus of $243M and $1.13).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM

  • "I want to disabuse any notion there is a priority for maximum employment," over price...

    "I want to disabuse any notion there is a priority for maximum employment," over price stability, says Bernanke, responding to a Senator's question. The Fed chair offers little to add to last week, but stocks have turned green as the hearing progresses. DJIA +0.2%. Europe: Stoxx 50 rebounds from a 1% loss, now +0.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM | 4 Comments
  • ACHN

    Achillion Pharmaceuticals (ACHN -16.4%) gets hammered after BofA Merrill Lynch cut the shares to...

    Achillion Pharmaceuticals (ACHN -16.4%) gets hammered after BofA Merrill Lynch cut the shares to Underperform on valuation, citing diminished M&A speculation that ramped its stock price up over 150% since October, leaving no further room for upside.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM

    Research In Motion (RIMM +2.1%) is trading higher, possibly due to remarks made at its DevCon...

    Becton Dickinson (BDX -3.6%) drifts lower after posting a lackluster FQ1 earnings report. Net profit fell 17% Y/Y on higher raw materials costs and expenses from recent acquisitions. It now expects to earn between $5.60 - $5.70, below the Street view of $5.80.
